title: India's monsoon starts withdrawing in delayed retreat
text:
India's monsoon starts withdrawing in delayed retreat

Commodities 1 hour ago (Oct 09, 2019 22:30)

India's monsoon starts withdrawing in delayed retreat MUMBAI, Oct 9 (Reuters) - India's monsoon rains started withdrawing from the northwest region from Wednesday, marking the most delayed retreat of the seasonal rainfall, the Indian Meteorological Department said on Wednesday. The monsoon generally begins in June and starts to retreat by Sept. 1, but rains have continued beyond that date this year and triggered floods that have killed hundreds. The previous record for the most delayed monsoon withdrawal was set in 1961, when the seasonal rainfall started retreating on Oct. 1, the weather office said. Monsoon rains in India were 10% above average in 2019 and the highest in 25 years, the office said last week. rains are crucial to farm output and economic growth because the agricultural sector accounts for about 15% of India's $2.5 trillion economy.

India's monsoon starts withdrawing in delayed retreat
description: India's monsoon starts withdrawing in delayed retreat
